How do you create a TOC

Have you used or heard of Sigil? Basically what it is is a WYSIWYG editor for ePubs. You open the ePub file in Sigil and see how the file is presented. MOST ePub files when downloaded and are in bad shape are bunched together to look like 4-5 different sections. Luckily, using Reliquary as an example its in EXCELLENT shape. what ill do is go through to EACH and every section and change the heading to hierarchy the Parts higher than the chapters. Thus creating the ldrop down look you would see in Calibre if you do a View eBook.

I usually open the ePub file from the folder in Calibre. So go to the root Calibre folder and find say Reliquary again right click on the file that says ePub. Then do an "Open With.." and it will pop up with available programs that would work and select Sigil that way when you finish and save the edit will already be made to the file in the Calibre folder of Reliquary.

Once you finish editing the headings for the sections be sure to select "Generate ToC" to check your headings and the look if something looks out of place or you messed up a heading you can know before hand and go back and find it.
